column1: Medullary cystic kidney diseasekidney disease is an inherited condition in which cysts in the center of each kidney cause the kidneys to gradually lose their ability to work.
Both lead to scarring of the kidney and fluid-filled cavities (cysts) in the deeper parts of the kidney.
This leads to too much urine production and the loss of sodium and other important chemicals from the blood.
MCKDMCKD occurs in older people.
NPH is found in young children.

Early in the disease, symptoms may include: - Excessive urination (polyuria) - Salt cravings - Urination at night (nocturia) - Weakness Late in the disease, symptoms of kidney failure may develop, which include: - Coma - Confusion - Decreased alertness - Easy bruising or bleeding - Fatigue - Frequent hiccups - Headache - Increased skin color (skin may appear yellow or brown) - Itching - Malaise (general ill feeling) - Muscle twitching or cramps - Nausea - Pale skin - Reduced sensation in the hands, feet, or other areas - Seizures - Vomiting blood or blood in the stool - Weight loss - Weakness
